Simpson, who has said he's sympathetic to Browder, claimed he was only after the facts, and he did turn up evidence of various financial shell games by Browder, shady maneuverings typical of the very rich.
They had one high card: Virtually all in Congress view attempts to smear Browder, a powerful whistle-blower on financial crimes and international human-rights abuses, as heretical.
Republican senators tried to make Simpson's venture with Veselnitskaya and Prevezon look treacherous.
In May, Prevezon settled the Justice Department suit for $5.8 million.
Prevezon, in turn, tried to make hay of these details, but failed.
